headline: Trump Threatens Trade Actions After EU Fines Google Over Ads
summary: The president made his warning in a social media post Friday after the EU announced it was fining Google almost €3 billion ($3.5 billion) and ordering the search giant to stop favoring its own advertising technology services.  “This is on top of the many other Fines and Taxes that have been issued against Google and other American Tech Companies, in particular,” Trump posted on social media.

raw.headline: Trump Threatens Trade Actions After EU Fines Google Over Ads
raw.summary: The president made his warning in a social media post Friday after the EU announced it was fining Google almost €3 billion ($3.5 billion) and ordering the search giant to stop favoring its own advertising technology services.  “This is on top of the many other Fines and Taxes that have been issued against Google and other American Tech Companies, in particular,” Trump posted on social media.

headline: What self-driving vehicles could mean for auto insurance rates
summary: According to a Bankrate survey, Americans pay a national average of $2,600 a year in auto insurance. Could autonomous vehicles help offset and lower rising insurance premiums? Insurance Information Institute chief economist Michel Leonard speaks with Mind Your Money host Allie Canal about how self-driving and assisted-driving technology could affect insurance rates for consumers, including how the variable it adds to potential accidents and insurance claims. Tesla (TSLA) launched its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, in June 2025, directly competing with autonomous driving innovator Waym. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Mind Your Money.

headline: US equity funds draw largest weekly inflow in three weeks
summary: U.S. equity funds attracted the largest net investment in three weeks in the week through September 3 driven by expectations for a potential Federal Reserve rate cut this month. A favorable antitrust ruling for technology conglomerate Alphabet also boosted appetite for the tech sector. Investors bought a net $2.42 billion worth of U.S. equity funds during the week, which was their largest weekly net purchase since August 13, LSEG Lipper data showed.

headline: Global equity fund inflows jump on rate cut expectations
summary: Global equity funds drew their biggest weekly inflows in three weeks in the period to September 3, lifted by growing expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut this month and a favorable antitrust ruling for Alphabet that buoyed sentiment. Investors poured a net $10.65 billion into global equity funds, the largest weekly purchase since August 13, data from LSEG Lipper showed. Signs of a cooling U.S. labor market and dovish remarks from Fed officials have strengthened bets on policy easing.

Signs of a cooling U.S. labor market and dovish remarks from Fed officials have strengthened bets on policy easing.

headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears
summary: The decision by a US district court judge Tuesday enabled Google’s parent to avoid the most punitive measures sought by regulators, including the sale of its Chrome browser.  With the case now out of the way, investors are turning their attention back to the potential for gains in Alphabet’s stock, which is the cheapest among the Magnificent Seven despite the recent rally.  “What it does is it clears the runway for additional growth opportunities,” said Neville Javeri, senior fund manager at Allspring Global Investments, referring to the ruling.

raw.headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears

headline: Apple’s Chairman of the Board Sold More Than $20 Million in Stock
summary: The chairman of  Apple’s  board sold more than $20 million of common stock late last month, filings show.  A Form 4 filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday shows Arthur Levinson sold 90,000 Apple shares on Aug. 28 on the open market at prices ranging from $231.815 to $232.36.  A separate document shows Levinson purchased the shares on Feb. 27, 2001, when they were worth around 29 cents each.

raw.headline: Apple’s Chairman of the Board Sold More Than $20 Million in Stock
raw.summary: The chairman of  Apple’s  board sold more than $20 million of common stock late last month, filings show.  A Form 4 filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday shows Arthur Levinson sold 90,000 Apple shares on Aug. 28 on the open market at prices ranging from $231.815 to $232.36.  A separate document shows Levinson purchased the shares on Feb. 27, 2001, when they were worth around 29 cents each.

headline: Trump Basks in Tech Leaders’ Spending Vows at White House Dinner
summary: In his opening remarks, Trump addressed a key concern of tech companies: ensuring there’s enough energy to meet surging power demands from the data centers behind the AI boom.  Thursday’s dinner marked a rare gathering in Washington of top executives and founders from some of the world’s most valuable tech companies — all vying for an edge in the emerging field of AI.

headline: OpenAI set to start mass production of its own AI chips with Broadcom in 2026, FT reports
summary: OpenAI and Broadcom did not immediately respond to Reuters' requests for comment after regular business hours.  Reuters had reported in February about OpenAI pushing ahead on its plan to reduce its reliance on Nvidia, opening a new tab for its chip supply by developing its first generation of in-house AI silicon.  Broadcom CEO Hock Tan said earlier on Thursday the company had secured more than $10 billion in AI infrastructure orders from a new customer, without naming it.

raw.headline: OpenAI set to start mass production of its own AI chips with Broadcom in 2026, FT reports

Reuters had reported in February about OpenAI pushing ahead on its plan to reduce its reliance on Nvidia, opening a new tab for its chip supply by developing its first generation of in-house AI silicon.  Broadcom CEO Hock Tan said earlier on Thursday the company had secured more than $10 billion in AI infrastructure orders from a new customer, without naming it.
